name: FluxzeroConfiguration
documentation:
Central configuration interface for a Fluxzero client instance.

This interface exposes all essential configuration components and extension points that influence message serialization, handler invocation, scheduling, caching, dispatching, user context, and more.

Implementations of this interface are typically created via {@link FluxzeroBuilder} and can be accessed through {@link Fluxzero#configuration()} at runtime.

Responsibilities

  • Provide serializers for messages, snapshots, and documents.
  • Define consumer tracking and dispatch configuration per {@link MessageType}.
  • Register interceptors and decorators for dispatching, batching, and handling messages.
  • Expose services like clock, caching, scheduling, and task execution.
  • Supply user and identity resolution logic for context-aware operations.

Custom configuration

Many of the returned values (e.g. interceptors, decorators, resolvers) are lists or maps that can be extended to modify the behavior of message handling and dispatch. Lists are ordered by priority (high or low), and are evaluated in that order during processing. @see Fluxzero @see FluxzeroBuilder

methods.name: cache
methods.documentation: Default cache used for internal stateful optimizations (e.g. handler state, snapshots).

methods.name: clock
methods.documentation: Provides a central clock used throughout the system for timestamps and scheduling.

methods.name: correlationDataProvider
methods.documentation: Returns the provider responsible for adding correlation data to outgoing messages.

methods.name: customConsumerConfigurations
methods.documentation: Provides custom consumer configurations per message type.

methods.name: customParameterResolvers
methods.documentation: Returns additional resolvers for injecting parameters into message handler methods.

methods.name: defaultConsumerConfigurations
methods.documentation: Provides the default consumer configuration per message type.

methods.name: defaultResponseMapper
methods.documentation: Default response mapper used for converting handler return values into generic responses.

methods.name: documentSerializer
methods.documentation: Returns the serializer used to store and retrieve documents in the {@code DocumentStore}.

methods.name: forwardingWebConsumer
methods.documentation:
Internal web consumer that can forward incoming {@code WebRequest} messages
 to a local HTTP server. Typically configured via {@link FluxzeroBuilder#forwardWebRequestsToLocalServer}.

methods.name: generalBatchInterceptors
methods.documentation: Interceptors applied to message batches during tracking and dispatch.

methods.name: highPrioDispatchInterceptors
methods.documentation: Dispatch interceptors applied before low-priority interceptors.

methods.name: highPrioHandlerDecorators
methods.documentation: Decorators applied to handlers before low-priority decorators.

methods.name: identityProvider
methods.documentation: Returns the provider used to generate or resolve application-specific identities.

methods.name: lowPrioDispatchInterceptors
methods.documentation: Dispatch interceptors applied after high-priority interceptors.

methods.name: lowPrioHandlerDecorators
methods.documentation: Decorators applied to handlers after high-priority decorators.

methods.name: makeApplicationInstance
methods.documentation: Whether the application instance should be created automatically on first use.

methods.name: messageRoutingInterceptor
methods.documentation: Special interceptor used to determine routing of dispatched messages (e.g. for multitenancy).

methods.name: propertySource
methods.documentation: Provides access to configuration properties (typically loaded from the environment).

methods.name: relationshipsCache
methods.documentation: Dedicated cache used to store and lookup relationships between entities.

methods.name: schedulingInterceptor
methods.documentation: Interceptor applied to scheduled messages, such as time-based commands or events.

methods.name: serializer
methods.documentation: Returns the primary serializer for serializing and deserializing message payloads.

methods.name: snapshotSerializer
methods.documentation: Returns the serializer used for serializing and deserializing snapshots of stateful entities.

methods.name: taskScheduler
methods.documentation: Task scheduler used for asynchronous background task execution.

methods.name: userProvider
methods.documentation: Returns the provider used to determine the current authenticated or active user.

methods.name: webResponseMapper
methods.documentation: Mapper used for converting web handler return values into {@code WebResponse} objects.
